result.execSummary:
The defendant Ledarious C Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

supervisions.notes: As to counts 2 & 3: Concurrent with each other. Credit for 194 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS AS TO CTS 2 & 3:
Cooperate with the Department.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with Radio Shack at 807 E Capitol, Office Depot at 362 E Capitol, Ray S, Joshua W, Mathias M-V, David C.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Possess no weapons. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

AS TO CT 2 ONLY: DNA surcharge waived in the interest of paying restitution. 

AS TO CTS 2 & 3: Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
After serving 4 years, defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

AS TO CT 3 ONLY: Court ordered defendant provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge, through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

Restitution hearing on 9-16-14 @ 8:30 a.m.  Judge Pocan, Br. 26.
**1/14/2015  
AS TO COUNT TWO:  $1,944.00 to Office Depot.
AS TO COUNT THREE:  $1,259.84 to Radio Shack.

Following amounts are for the dismissed and read in counts on 13CM5105 and 13CM4406, owed to Office Depot:  $242.87; $388.20; $388.20; and $308.54.
To be collected by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) Wis. stats. Any balance due as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Defendant Ledarious C Sanders in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Ledarious C Sanders in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, CONCURRENT with count 3, with credit for 194 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 years.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, CONCURRENT with count 2, with credit for 194 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 years.  After serving 4 years, the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
Terms of extended supervision:
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-Possess no weapons
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No contact with Radio Shack at 807 E Capitol, Office Depot at 362 E Capitol, Ray S, Joshua W, Mathias M-V, David C.
-Seek and maintain full time employment

The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--pay surcharge in count 3 through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  Surcharge in count 2 waived in the interest of paying restitution.
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant    
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting

Defendant Ledarious C Sanders in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Ledarious C Sanders in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Count 1:  Dismissed and read in
Count 2 and 3:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court orders pre sentence investigation and defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
